critique: The executive order is a legal document that aims to block the assets of the Haitian government and de facto regime. It also prohibits certain transactions with Haiti. The order is intended to address a national emergency and implement United Nations Security Council Resolution No. 841. The primary emotions conveyed are likely to be fear and disgust towards the actions of the de facto regime in Haiti, as well as a sense of surprise at the extent of the measures being taken. There might also be a sense of sadness about the situation in Haiti that necessitates such actions. Joy is not an emotion that the president wants to convey.
